definitions: To praise excessively, especially from motives of self-interest.
To make someone feel pleased by praising them or expressing admiration.
To present favorably or make something appear better or more attractive than it really is.
To give a pleasing or favorable impression.
examples: He tried to flatter his boss to get a promotion.
The dress really flatters her figure.
Don't flatter yourself; you're not that special.
The artist's portrait flattered the subject.
